subject: Philosophy
title: What Is Knowledge?
description: A quick, practical guide to What Is Knowledge?.

hook.text: You believe the earth is round. You're right. But is that the same as knowing it?

buildup.text: Plato defined knowledge as justified true belief. You need all three parts.

discovery.text: Belief alone isn't enough. You must also be correct and have good reasons for your belief.

twist.text: This tidy definition held for two thousand years. Then Edmund Gettier broke it in 1963.

climax.text: Philosophers have spent sixty years trying to fix Plato's formula. No one fully has.

punchline.text: Knowing what knowledge is turns out to be hard.

quiz.question: What is Plato's classic definition of knowledge?
